intro: Cyphanthera × cuneata, commonly known as the hybrid blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Cyphanthera × cuneata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
